# 🔒 Security Policy

## Reporting a Vulnerability

Please **DO NOT** file a public issue to report a security vulnerability.

If you discover a security issue, please report it by sending an email to **{{SECURITY_EMAIL}}**. This will help ensure that any vulnerabilities that are found can be [disclosed responsibly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Responsible_disclosure) to any affected parties.

## Supported Versions

| Version | Supported          |
|---------|-------------------|
{{VERSION_SUPPORT_TABLE}}

## Security Update Process

Security updates will be released according to the following process:

1. 🔍 Security issues are thoroughly investigated upon report
2. 🚀 Critical patches are released as soon as possible
3. 📢 Updates are announced via {{SECURITY_ANNOUNCEMENT_CHANNEL}}
4. 🔄 Previous versions receive backported fixes when critical

## Communication

- 📧 Security alerts are sent to registered users
- 🔔 Critical updates are posted to {{SECURITY_UPDATE_CHANNEL}}
- 📝 A full security advisory is published with each fix

## Security Best Practices

{{SECURITY_BEST_PRACTICES}}

## Vulnerability Disclosure Timeline

1. 🕐 0 day: Initial report received
2. 🕑 1-2 days: Initial confirmation and investigation
3. 🕒 3-7 days: Investigation and patch development
4. 🕓 7-14 days: Patch testing and preparation
5. 🕔 14-21 days: Public disclosure and patch release
